Weary Eric Schmidt has played his innings very well, said analyst Sandeep Aggarwal of Caris& Co.. The management reshuffling appears to be amicable. Headteachers will be able to discipline pupils who misbehave on their way to and from school but rules forcing teachers to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Michael Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom.`` Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. But the bill also includes an unexpected additional clause making university students pay higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans. The Michael Government says this has to be included before the new university funding regime

, no doubt, will be applied to many, many other places.
